data.title: Fire & Rescue or EMS Related Documentaries and Film
data.meta_description: Documentaries about Fire & Rescue or EMS events and topics. Also popular film that features firefighters prominently.
data.text:
Documentaries

America Burning: The Yarnell Hill Fire Tragedy and the Nation's Wildfire Crisis: Follows the Granite Mountain Hotshots and our nations wildfire readiness.

9/11 the Filmmakers Commemorative Edition: Following the FDNY during 9/11.

911 The Firefighters Story: Following the FDNY during 9/11.

A Good Job: Stories of the FDNY: Following actor Steve Buscemi inside Manhattan's Engine House 55, which he joined at 22 years old.

Behind the Uniform: A Look inside the Cincinnati Fire Department: Following members of the Cicinnati Fire Department.

Brave are the Fallen: About fallen firefighter Thomas Wall.

Brotherhood: Life in the FDNY: An insider's point-of-view of the fire service, focusing on three fire companies.

Burn: Following Detroit firefighters.

Charleston 9: The Ultimate Sacrafice: Looks at the changes made and how the Charleston (S.C.) Fire Department recovered following the deaths of nine firefighters.

Decade of Fire: Follows the Bronx in the 1970s when fires were rampant.

Detroit on Fire: Following Detroit firefighters.

Fire in Paradise: Frontline documenting the Camp fire

Firefighting: A Life of its Own: About a day in the life of a firefighter on Knoxville FD.

Firestorm: Following wildland firefighters.

First In, Last Out: A History of Firefighting in Indianapolis: Traces the history of firefighting in Indianapolis.

For the Love of Their Brother: Following a firefighter that died on 9/11.

History of Firefighting: Discussing the history of firefighting.

Into the Fire: A glimpse inside fire station camaraderie.

Meet the Warriors of the West: Following wildland firefighters.

Naudet Brothers 9/11 Documentary: Following the FDNY during 9/11.

The Battalion: An unscripted reality show following firehouses around the country.

The Call: Following volunteer firefighters in rural Virginia.

The Fire Asylum: Following six firefighters going through an intense training program inside an abandoned West Virginia Penitentiary.

The Firefighters' Story (UK): Traces the history of the Fire Brigade Union since its inception at the end of the First World War.

Walking with Fire: Following wildland firefighters.

Woman on Fire: Following New York City's first openly transgender firefighter.
